snippet: A South African doctor on a layover in the United Arab Emirates is trapped there by criminal charges he had not been aware of.
abstract: Dr Cyril Karabus, pediatric oncologist from South Africa, has been trapped in the United Arab Emirates for seven months fighting charges of manslaughter and forgery linked to his treatment of 3-year-old patient who died under his care during six week stint working in Abu Dhabi in 2002; Karabus had unknowingly been convicted in absentia in 2003 and sentenced to three years in prison, stark example of foreign professionals who are drawn to gulf only to be caught up in Emirati justice.
lead_paragraph: A South African doctor on a layover in the United Arab Emirates is trapped there by criminal charges he had not been aware of.

headline.seo: United Arab Emirates’ Laws Ensnare a Doctor
headline.main: Emirates’ Laws Trap a Doctor Just Passing Through
headline.print_headline: Emirates’ Laws Trap a Doctor Just Passing Through
